summary:
Please refer to my personal website for the most up to date information: tonyhungry.github.io 

Tony of all trades: data expert, economist, research methodologist, environmental scientist, and part-time musician. Looking for opportunities where I could leverage my diverse skill set, multidisciplinary knowledge, and my worldly experiences (lived in Taiwan, Cape Town, Amsterdam, Paris, London, and Prague!).

school.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)
Prague University of Economics and Business

education.field_of_study: International Economics (Hons) and Quantitative Environmental Science (Hons)
Liberal Arts and Sciences, General Studies and Humanities

awards.title: Best Tutor Award
awards.description: Awarded for the best graduating subject tutor.
awards.issuer: Director of AUP ARC, Ann Borel

projects.title: Eurostat MNO Estimation and Evaluation
projects.description: After completing the summer coding lab, I decided to continue working on the project in close collaboration with Eurostat staff to continue research in mobile network operator data.

courses.name: Climate Change: Science, Economics and Policy

profile_positions.description:
- Courses taught or teaching: EBC2019 Banking, EBC1009 Economics and Business, EBC2138 Job Performance and the Employment Relationship, EBS1001 Reflections on Academic Discourse / Philosophy of Science, EBC1018 Macroeconomics, EBC2023 Managerial Economics, EBP4003 Economics Case Studies, EBC2109 Network Economics, EBC1030 International Economic Relations 
- Master and Bachelor Thesis Examiner
- Completing the UTQ/BKO certification
- Volunteer First Responder
profile_positions.title: Economics Lecturer

profile_positions.company: Prague University of Economics and Business
profile_positions.description: Data analysis, database construction and management using Stata
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Research and development on the process of mobile network operator data for official statistics using R
profile_positions.title: Intern | Eurostat Coding Labs

profile_positions.description: Tasked with methodological research, data analysis and database management using R and Excel.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Intern

profile_positions.description:
Participated in the KPMG Data Analytics Consulting Virtual Internship.
Completed practical task modules in Data Quality Assessment, Data Insights and Presentation.
Skills gained from this experience: data quality analysis, analytical dashboard creation, data analytics, customer segmentation, data driven presentations, data dashboards, data visualizations, and presentations. Tools used: Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Powerpoint, and Tableau.
profile_positions.title: Virtual Intern | Data Analytics Consulting

profile_positions.description:
Tutored 7 different undergraduate courses. 

Managed regular and exceptional review sessions and assisted professors with grading, invigilating, and guest-lecturing.
profile_positions.title: Academic Tutor

profile_positions.description:
Sales Assistant for the university bookstore.

Assisted with daily sales operations, stock control, and general appearance of the bookstore.

Managed rush distribution and produced insights on bookstore stock management and AUP community engagement.
profile_positions.title: Sales Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Research Assistant at The Joy & Edward Frieman Center for Environmental Science.

Tasked with performing experiments and data analysis.

Research presented at the Evolution Montpellier 2018 Conference in France and the 2019 European Geophysical Union General Assembly in Vienna, Austria.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: American International School of Cape Town

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.company: American International School of Cape Town
profile_positions.description: Assisted high school and middle school science departments across all levels. Managed all laboratory preparation and organization. Assisted with grading, invigilating, and at times, guest-lectured for science teachers. Assisted with curriculum planning and the led the production of the annual science fair.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description: Focused on facilitating and managing the lab and assisted bachelor thesis students.
profile_positions.title: Laboratory Assistant

company.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Represented the LSE Geography and Environment Department for all school wide functions.

Advocated for diverse and non-exam based assessments, improvement of the course choice system (in effect), pre-arrival mentor assignment (in effect), and more study spaces on campus.

Nominated as the graduate student representative for the LSE Education Committee by the super student representative forum.

company.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Represented the whole MSc Environmental Economics and Climate Change program.

Met bi-weekly, surveyed students on program satisfaction, and proposed changes to faculty administration.
Assisted Dr. McAssey with weekly calculus revisions.

Represented first year students on the Academic Core Committee. 

Advocated for diverse course choices.
